intro: Urvillea filipes, commonly known as the slender urvillea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Urvillea filipes is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
